emuInput.TitMainTitle: NAACP workers, seated from left: Melusena Carl Whitlock, Lucy Robinson or Susan Fowler, Coretta Ogburn, John G. Jones, Romaine Jackson Childs; standing: Rev. Samuel L. Spear and Boyd L. Wilson, gathered around table for 1954 NAACP Membership Campaign
emuInput.CatDescriptText:
The board in background reads: "1954 NAACP Membership Campaign, Rev. James B. Cayce, Chairperson  Mrs. Daisy Lampkin Gaines Bradford, Co-Chairmen   Captains:  J. K. Anderson,  Mrs. Jimetta M. Andrews, Baptist Temple, Mrs. Edna G. Bonner, Mrs. Homer S. Brown, Miss Melusena Gar..., Rev. Jas. B. Cayce, Mrs. Romaine..., Mrs. Mildred C..., Mrs. Sue Cor..., Rev. Chas..., Mrs. Florence Jones,  Totals to Date: Members: 579,  Cash 1599.00".

Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 22, 1954, pg. 4, reads: "Pittsburgh NAACP Seeks Members - The Pittsburgh Branch of the NAACP is in the midst of a drive for 7,500 members.  These memberships help support not only the local program but the national and state programs of the organization.  Some of the workers present at the report meeting Tuesday were, seated, left to right: Miss Melusena Carl, Mrs. Lucy Robinson, Mrs. Coretta Ogburn, John G. Jones and Mrs. Romaine Childs.  Behind them are the Rev. Samuel L. Spear and Boyd L. Wilson. - Harris Photo."
